page.title: 07RECREATION IN HINXWORTH (2)
page.content: THE WHIST DRIVE - One of the few remaining weekly events is the Whist Drive held in the village hall on Friday evenings. The game played is partner whist and is gaining popular- ity with players coming from the surrounding villages and towns but not from Hinxworth itself.Drives have been held here in the hall since it was built in 1949 and prior to that in the former church hall at Rectory Corner. THE CRICKET CLUB - The present club was founded in 1979 following the building of more houses and a populat- ion increase. It has never been able to field all 11 players from the village because there are just not enough cricketers. 1985 has been its best year despite one of the worst summers for years only one match was lost through rain. At the end of the season a function is held in the pub.
